name: offshore platform production, natural gas | offshore platform, natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7360/documentation

Data relates to the platform Odin, which belonged to Esso Norway. The life time is 11 years with a total production of 27.7 Mrd. Nm3 natural gas.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Material and energy requirements of a natural gas offshore platform.
category: C:Manufacturing/30:Manufacture of other transport equipment/301:Building of ships and boats/3011:Building of ships and floating structures

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Energy and water requirements out of 1980 data. The material requirements were reported in 1996.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The Odin platform was situated in the North Sea, 178 km off the coast west of Bergen.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data relates to the platform Odin, which belonged to Esso Norway. The Odin platform is a gas installation with a steel jacket, on top drilling equipment, living quarters. It is fairly small (40x40x112 meters). The platform was installed in 1983 and the field closed in 1994. 1996 the platform was brought ashore for dismantling.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data for Odin are extrapolated for GLO. The total quantity of material is about 30% less as in Frischknecht et al. 1996. It is assumed that after dismantling ashore the materials are dumped in landfill. The energy and water requirements for construction and installation of the platform are assumed to be correlating to the weight of the equipment in the same relation as for the Leman field in Klitz 1980.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: No information on sampling procedure. Standard transport distances are used.
